item.title: Custom Sidebar - Child Themes in Wordpress
item.description:
1. Register Custom Sidebar in functions.php 2. Create Custom Sidebar File 3. Call Custom Sidebar! 4. Style as Desired
The nice thing about child themes is that it gives you a full theme as a base, while also allowing for endless customization. Any file that you write in your child theme, e.g. functions.php, header.php, sidebar.php, will overwrite the parent theme's file. It's worth mentioning that this doesn't seem to be working on my local WordPress install, with theme Twenty Seventeen.
